Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The structure of the BPMN process was observed to identify the key stages: market research, R&D, securing components from multiple countries, assembly in Malaysia, quality checks, distribution methods, customs compliance, regional distribution centers, inventory monitoring, etc.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Focusing on the parallel gateway where components are sourced from different countries: questions such as why these specific countries were chosen and what risks could be involved were deduced.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Taking the step of assembly in Malaysia as an example, generalizing questions like why this location was chosen and thinking about implications of a 24/7 operation on the broader supply chain.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Questions were hypothesized regarding quality checks, thresholds for passing, and the implications of repeated failures on the overall efficiency of the supply chain.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Considering factors influencing distribution methods (air freight vs. cargo shipping), balancing cost-speed trade-offs was used as a heuristic to guide the creation of corresponding questions.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Examining customs compliance, the reasoning inferred that challenges such as delays or rejections may arise from regional regulations, prompting related questions.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Ensuring all required aspects (rationale, improvements, risk management, decision-making, communication, performance) were being addressed by the generated questions.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Reviewing earlier steps to ensure all major stages in the BPMN process were covered by questions and revisiting areas like stakeholder communication for completeness.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: Incorporating potential ethical concerns such as environmental impact and labor conditions into the questions for a comprehensive evaluation.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Expanding the scope of questions to areas like criteria for selecting regional distribution centers and the rationale behind VIP shipments, generalizing from the stages above.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: From the broader goal of performance measurement, specific KPIs were deduced as a useful point of inquiry for understanding how efficiency and resilience are balanced.

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - IND
Text: Exploring alternative scenarios, such as what would happen if some suppliers or transportation methods were unavailable, prompting related risk management questions.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Using heuristic approaches, like identifying geographical hubs and their accessibility, to frame questions about the rationale behind regional distribution center locations.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Observing patterns in the process flow, such as the repeated use of parallel gateways, enabled the formulation of questions regarding their significance and impact.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Reviewing the questions for their ability to prompt thought-provoking exploration, ensuring each ties back to rationale, improvement, risks, communication, or performance.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Returning to earlier stages to incorporate missed areas, such as inventory monitoring and sales forecasting, ensuring all aspects of the process are questioned.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Generating hypothetical scenarios to explore decision-making during demand changes and adjustments to supplier orders.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Inferring that specific bottlenecks (e.g., customs clearance) could impact the entire chain, leading to questions on handling such challenges.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: Considering how the supply chain process integrates sustainability and ethical practices, leading to questions on environmental and labor concerns.
